https://greenkeeper.io/

ignore all files starting with `.git`

Let watcher and compiler automatically ignore all files and folders
starting with `.git`. This fixes an infinite compilation loop issue when
running `roots watch` on Windows with Visual Studio Code open => watcher
was detecting changes to `.gitignore` every few seconds.
Supporting envs other than development/production
Add line breaks to long call to charge.hygienist
Pass through options to Hygienist, so you can use custom extensions with it
Turning on logging should call Columnist middleware, not Journalist

Make --no-open have effect once again.

Hey there.

The new version got lots of improvements. Much more stable now.

Made tests execute on Windows.

coffeelint does search recursively for *.coffee files by itself (tested version 1.9.3). No need for find, which doesn't work on Windows.
Fixed complied files not being renamed on Windows (see https://github.com/jenius/roots/issues/588)
Switched to use when/node .lift to ensure functions listen to promises inside hook functions.

fixes #286

remove jquery from livereload injected code

Ok lets think about this one, people who are using roots are in a browser that supports JSON.parse and XMLHttpRequest, Anyway we were already using raw websockets so... we were already depending on someone using a modern browser

fixes #294

wrap live reload in a closure

so that we no longer pollute the global namespace

do not ignore components folder from watcher by default

fixes #293

Report stylus warnings through the error pipeline

Without this, warnings are basically useless since most roots
users do not have their terminal open and or are activly looking at said output.

Only print compiling message when we are actually compiling

This was being printed on file removal, which was not accurate

Only unlink the public file if it is there.

This was mostly an issue with partial files that did not exist in the public dir
